text:
- Accelya is a leading provider
of technology solutions

and services to the airline
and travel industries.
All our customers wanted to grow.
They had transaction volume business
and they wanted to continue pushing,
and we just couldn't keep up with demand.

So we really engaged
AWS just as an outlet.
We needed to grow very quickly.

And we needed to be able to
engage in a lift and shift

that didn't take a lot
of time and something

that really could satisfy
our customers overall.

It wasn't so much what we built,
it's how quickly we did it.

And, you know, I would
say within two days,

we had a proof of concept of
production environment running.
It could absolutely run our workloads.
We did a lot of testing
and we had a very engaged group internally
as well as with the AWS team.

But what we proved out is this
is a viable solution for us.
We are a legacy world where, you know,

we have mainframes, we have
a lot of legacy thinking.

But the cloud again is
really the catalyst.
We have opportunity now to move at a pace

that really dictates what we
can do and how we can do it.

So we're really giving
airlines the ability

to change their future, to
bring value to the customers
at a pace that they couldn't do before.

So to me, you know, as part of
this migration to the cloud,
it's not just stability.
It's not just telemetry.
It's not just about cost,
but it's really the catalyst for change.
From the customer standpoint, it was huge.

I mean, they saw almost
overnight stability.

They can see telemetry like
they've never seen before.
Previously in our on-prem solutions,

we just didn't have the
right software or a standard
of how we did things.
But you, you know, like I said,
proof is always in the pudding.

When they take a look at how
stable their products are,

how they can grow, and
they see that we were able

to keep up with demand,
it was exciting for them.

Ultimately, it really boils
down to how much growth

can they see and they
saw that very quickly
with our changed database.
